articles.description: Spinner Liam Dawson will play his first Test in eight years after being named in the England team to face India at Old Trafford on Wednesday.
articles.title: England vs India teams: Liam Dawson to play first Test in eight years

articles.description: Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike's arrival is set to take Liverpool's summer spending past £250m.
articles.title: Hugo Ekitike: Liverpool agree £69m fee for Eintracht Frankfurt striker

articles.description: McLaren Racing CEO Zak Brown says he was "not surprised" Christian Horner was sacked as team boss of Red Bull.
articles.title: Christian Horner: Zak Brown 'not surprised' former Red Bull boss was sacked

articles.description: Owen Farrell talks about the passion he provokes in the rugby public as he prepares to lead the British and Irish Lions on Tuesday.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Owen Farrell on criticism he faces

articles.description: President Donald Trump threatens to block Washington Commanders' new stadium build if the team does not revert to their original name.
articles.title: Washington Commanders: President Donald Trump threatens stadium block unless Commanders change name

articles.description: Steve Tandy is appointed Wales men's head coach and will lead the side into the 2027 World Cup in Australia.
articles.title: Steve Tandy: Wales appoint Scotland defence coach as head coach

articles.description: Mikel Arteta is not ruling out bringing more new signings on Arsenal's pre-season tour as negotiations for striker Viktor Gyokoeres continue.
articles.title: Mikel Arteta does not rule out more signings for Arsenal - 'we are still short'

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler is head and shoulders the best player in the world, but Rory McIlroy does not need to look far for motivation, says Iain Carter.
articles.title: The Open 2025: 'Toppling Scottie Scheffler becomes next objective for Rory McIlroy'

articles.description: Manager Mikel Arteta says Arsenal followed the right processes when dealing with former midfielder Thomas Partey, who played while under police investigation for multiple counts of rape.
articles.title: Thomas Partey: Mikel Arteta '100%' sure Arsenal followed right processes

articles.description: England's players were racially abused during their second Test victory over Argentina in San Juan on 12 July.
articles.title: England players racially abused during second Test win over Argentina
